bug.short_desc: There is no decent way to debug sieve scripts

long_desc.thetext: We are using cyrus-imap for a few years now, but sometimes mysteriously sieve scripts don't seem to do what they should, and I have yet to find a way to find out why a certain script doesn't work. There should be intuitive feedback when a script is executed, either via a "debug" flag or at least in log-files. For the rest cyrus-imap is a fine piece of software, but there is a serious lack of documentation, so there is chance that I just couldn't find a way to somehow "turn on" debugging... Btw: Is it possible to make sieve scripts that use "fileinto" a folder that is not a subfolder of INBOX at all? How? Why doesn't it work? I have not found any evidence in the Changelog that indicates this problem to be resolved in newer versions, so I file this bug-report/whish-list.

Yes, fileinto can be used to put a message in any mailbox, provided you have permission to do so. To fileinto a non-personal mailbox (anything outside of INBOX.*) you need to have the 'i' (insert) right on the mailbox. It has always been this way, nothing has changed in this regard.
